description: Erection of two storey rear extension at basement and ground floor to facilitate the partial change of use from Class E to 1 x self contained residential unit (Use Class C3) at part basement and part ground floors.
subdivision_of_building: rear of basement and ground floor unit
decision_conditions: <p>In the absence of a suitable undertaking to secure that the occupiers of the new residential units would not be able to apply for on street parking permit, the proposals would have an adverse impact on street parking conditions, highway safety and sustainable modes of transport, contrary to Policies T1 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2021) Policies LP43 and LP45.<br></p>

<p>The proposed development would result in the provision of substandard and poor form of living conditions for future occupiers in terms lack of daylight, sunlight and outlook, to the detriment of the long term health and well being of future occupiers of the development, contrary to London Plan (2021) Policy D6, LP2 and LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).<br></p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-kerning: auto; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-variation-settings: normal;">The proposed residential refuse and recycle store, due to its poor location, distance and inappropriate access route, it fails to provide an accessibly safe and secure passage for the future occupants and fail to meet the requirements for refuse collection vehicles and operatives. The development would be contrary to Policies LP57 of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020)</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-kerning: auto; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-variation-settings: normal;">The proposed new residential unit would incorporate poor access arrangements from the public highway to the detriment of the safe and secure passage for future occupiers, the development would&nbsp;provide inappropriate access / egress to the dwellings to the detriment of pedestrian safety and demonstrates the overall poor quality of design and layout, contrary to London Plan 2021 policy T4, Policy LP42 of the&nbsp;Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020)</p>

<p>The proposed development, by reason of lack of provision of affordable housing, would fail to adequately contribute towards the provision of mixed and balanced communities and housing need in the local area. As such, the development would not be consistent with Policies H4 and H5 of the London Plan (2021), Hackney Local Plan Policies LP33 (2020) LP12, LP13 and NPPF (2023) paragraph 63 and the Hackney S106 Planning Contributions Supplementary Planning Document (2020).<br></p>

<p>The proposed development, by reason of a lack of sufficient energy efficiency measures and/or financial contribution towards carbon offsetting, would fail to achieve the maximum feasible reductions in carbon dioxide emissions, contrary to Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020) Policy LP55 and London Plan (2021) Policy SI2.&nbsp;<br></p>
